title: Medal of Honor for Staff Sgt. Ryan M. Pitts
body:
**What is it?**

President Barack Obama will award the Medal of Honor, nation's highest award for valor, to former [Staff Sgt. Ryan M. Pitts](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts?from=st) during a ceremony at the White House, today at 3:00 p.m. EDT. Ryan is the tenth Soldier to receive the Medal of Honor for operations in Afghanistan.


**What has the Army done?** 

The Office of the Chief of Public Affairs created a [website](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts/?from=st) to pay tribute to Staff Sgt. Pitts' actions above and beyond the call of duty in the Vehicle Patrol Base Kahler in the vicinity of Wanat Village, Afghanistan,  on July 13, 2008.  Visitors to [Staff Sgt. Pitts' website](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts?from=st) can access a biography, [the official narrative](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts/battle/index.html#full_narrative/?from=st), [photos](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts/media/index.html#multimedia_section/?from=st), and interviews. 

The White House ceremony will be [live streamed](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts/profile/index.html?from=st) from the [website](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts/?from=st) and live tweeted from [#USArmy Twitter](https://twitter.com/usarmy/?from=st) platform.



**What efforts does the Army plan to continue in the future?**

In addition to the White House Ceremony, Army senior leaders will recognize Pitts, his family, and friends during a [Hall of Heroes Induction Ceremony](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/pitts/profile/index.html?from=st) at the Pentagon, scheduled on July 22, 2014, at 10:00 a.m. EDT. 


**Why is this important to the Army?**

Staff Sgt. Pitts embodies the attributes of a [Professional](http://www.army.mil/e2/c/downloads/336937.pdf) Soldier.  During the battle of Vehicle Patrol Base Kahler, vicinity of Wanat Village, Pitts lived out the [Soldier's Creed](http://www.army.mil/values/soldiers.html) as he fought for his teammates and the nation. Today, Ryan employs his competence, character, and commitment within a *new* profession, living the [Army Values](http://www.army.mil/standto/archive_2013-08-15) alongside citizens he once served.

quote:
Focus Quote for the Day
-------------------------

This award isn't about what I did; it's about what we did as a team. It belongs to everybody who was there that day.

### - Former Staff Sgt. Ryan Pitts, on being nominated to receive the nation's highest military honor for valor, the Medal of Honor, for his incredible bravery at Vehicle Patrol Base Kahler in the vicinity of Wanat Village, Afghanistan, on July 13, 2008. 

### [Former Soldier to receive Medal of Honor for fierce battle in Afghanistan](http://www.army.mil/article/128651?from=st)
